benchmark_details.name: CRUD-RAG: A Comprehensive Chinese Benchmark for Retrieval-Augmented Generation of Large Language Models
benchmark_details.overview: CRUD-RAG is a comprehensive benchmark that evaluates Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems through various application scenarios categorized into Create, Read, Update, and Delete (CRUD), providing a robust evaluation framework for language models handling external knowledge.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive evaluation framework for RAG systems, facilitating the assessment of their performance across various CRUD application scenarios.

data.source: Constructed from nearly 300,000 historical news articles from major Chinese news websites.
data.size: 86,834 retrieval documents and various datasets for evaluation tasks totaling 10,728 for text continuation, 10,728 for multi-document summarization, 3,199 for single-document QA, 3,192 for multi-document QA, 5,130 for hallucination modification.
data.annotation: Datasets were created using automated generation via GPT-4 with manual refinement for QA tasks to ensure quality.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated by comparing output against ground truth using specific scoring mechanisms designed for various tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores in metrics indicate better performance of RAG systems in generating accurate and relevant text based on retrieval.
methodology.baseline_results: Experiments conducted with various LLMs including GPT-3.5, GPT-4, and Qwen-14B for comparison.
methodology.validation: Extensive evaluation through various experiments demonstrating the efficacy of RAG across the CRUD framework.
